summary: The FinOps Specialist course offered by בית הספר להייטק וסייבר at אוניברסיטת בר אילן is designed to prepare finance professionals for careers in cloud environments. The course covers a range of topics including AWS Cloud basics, architectural principles, key services, security and compliance, cloud pricing and billing, and FinOps tools and practices. It includes practical exercises such as AWS Cost Explorer and use case brainstorming. The course is hybrid, allowing participants to choose between attending on-campus in רמת גן or via Zoom.
full_text:
COURSE NAME: FinOps Specialist

COURSE OVERVIEW: The FinOps Specialist course at Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber invites you to develop your next career in the financial world of cloud computing.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: January 31, 2025
- Duration: 8 sessions over 40 academic hours
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00

LEARNING FORMAT: The course is hybrid, with classes held both on the Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to your preference.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- To schedule an admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Describe the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Describe basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.
- Cloud Concept and overall review.
- Main Cloud Services.
- FinOps – What is it and why is it needed?
- Cloud pricing and billing.
- Finance tools and options, including commitments and agreements.
- AWS cost explorer introduction.
- Use case and brainstorming.
- Cost Control – Tags, Alerts, Budgeting, etc.
- Use case and brainstorming.
- K8S- Introduction, high-level technical review, FinOps point of view.
- FinOps third-party tools and products.
- Cloud cost monitoring.
- Tips for success and best practices.
- Final Exam/Exercise – based on AWS Cost Explorer.
